meanings.definition: The rise and fall of the voice in speaking.
meanings.sent1: Her intonation showed excitement as she told the story.
meanings.sent2: His intonation changed when he asked a question.
meanings.sent3: The robot's intonation was so monotone that it sounded like a machine.
meanings.sent4: The intonation of the song echoed through the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's intonation was so clear that everyone understood.

meanings.definition: The manner of producing musical tones.
meanings.sent1: The singer's intonation was flawless during the performance.
meanings.sent2: Musicians pay attention to intonation to create harmonious melodies.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow had a strange intonation that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The intonation of the violin resonated beautifully in the room.
meanings.sent5: The intonation of the flute was so pure it brought tears to the audience's eyes.
